info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:09AM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow, with areas of freezing rain. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches, with lighter snow accumulations being across the south Portland metro. Ice accumulations of a tenth to a quarter of an inch this afternoon. East to northeast winds will gust 35 to 55 mph, with strongest winds over the West Hills and the east Portland metro area. * WHERE...Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, mainly in the eastern Portland metro. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and some powerlines. The cold wind chills as low as 10 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions expected across the east Portland metro during peak snowfall rates later this afternoon and evening. Sleet may also mix with snow at times which would lead to lower snowfall amounts, mainly across the south Portland metro.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
